name: Aldo Leopold Bench
notes: Made for my sister's wedding. The design comes from Aldo Leopold himself — he built the original from Wisconsin River materials. The trick is you sit backward, facing away, so you can use binoculars or a camera without leaning forward. It's a bench designed for watching.

name: Fallen Ash High Table
notes: The wood came from trees that fell in storms and was given away as slabs at the 2014 Atwood Festival in Madison. I dried it in my garage for two years before building. The hairpin legs came off a tiled table I found on the street. It ended up taller than I intended — works well as a TV stand.
